titleproper.value:
Guide to the Carl Geiser Audio Collection
          <num>ALBA.AUDIO.004</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Jenny Pondo and Gail Malmgreen, 2010

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace
        <date>2017-09-06T16:09:44</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value:
Carl Frederick Geiser was born in
        Orrville, Ohio on December 10, 1910. He fought with the International Brigades in the
        Spanish Civil War as a member of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade and was taken prisoner and held
        in a fascist prisoner of war camp for a year before being released in April 1939. After a
        successful career as an aeronautical engineer, he retired in 1971 and began to research and
        write a history of American volunteers captured during the Spanish Civil War. His labors
        resulted in the publication of <emph render="bolditalic">Prisoners of the Good Fight: The
          Spanish Civil War 1936-1939</emph> in 1986. This collection consists of 35 audiocassettes,
        most of them interviews with former prisoners conducted as part of the research for Geiser's
        book. Also included are some taped "reflections" by Geiser in trips to Cuba and
        Spain.

p.value:
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F.
        Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment,
        tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

Geiser returned to New York and secured an engineering position with Liquidometer, a
        manufacturer of aeronautic equipment. By the early 1970s, Geiser turned his attention once
        more to Spain. Upon retirement at age 71, Geiser began to write a comprehensive history of
        American volunteers captured during the Spanish Civil War. With the assistance of fellow
        prisoner Robert Steck, Geiser amassed biographical information on the 120 Americans
        incarcerated in Spanish prisons. He also corresponded with over 150 veterans worldwide to
        solicit their reminiscences, and traveled to archives in the United States and Europe to
        conduct research. Five years of research and writing culminated in the publication of <emph
          render="italic">Prisoners of the Good Fight</emph> (Lawrence Hill and Co., 1986).

Most of the 35 tapes in this collection contain interviews, comments and discussions
        recorded in the 1970s and 80s in connection with research for Carl Geiser's book, <emph
          render="italic">Prisoners of the Good Fight</emph>. Also included are Geiser's taped
        "reflections' on the Spanish Civil War and on a trip to Cuba.

corpname.value:
Spain. Ejército Popular de la República. Abraham Lincoln
        Battalion
